abstract.text: Ensures that document data is written safely to a specified location in the application sandbox.

inlineContent.text: The document data to write to disk. Typically, the data is encapsulated by an
object (if a flat file) or an
object (if a file package).
If the object encapsulating the document data is of some other type, you should override this method or
to perform the actual writing of the data.
A dictionary of
file attributes to assign to the document file. The default implementation obtains these file attributes by calling
The file URL specifying the location of the document file in the application sandbox.
A constant that indicates whether the document file is being written the first time or whether it is being overwritten. See
for details.
This method is called by the
method to save the file data (and associated attributes in the case of an
). It creates temporary files and directories as necessary so that successful saves can be completed atomically and failed saves can be rolled back cleanly. This method calls
to save the
object, passing the location for the new saved file in the
parameter and the location of the previously existing file in the
parameter, if this is an overwrite operation.
If you want to change how file data is saved, you generally override the
method instead of this method. Additionally, you don’t need to call this method directly unless you are overriding the
method.
In Swift, this method is marked with the
keyword to indicate that it throws an error in cases of failure.
When overriding this method, use the
statement to throw an

abstract.text: A convenient interface to the contents of the file system, and the primary means of interacting with it.
A representation of a node (a file, directory, or symbolic link) in the file system.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A false value.
A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An abstract base class for managing discrete portions of your app’s data.
Constants that specify the type of save operation.
Asynchronously closes the document after saving any changes.
Returns the document data to be saved.
Returns a dictionary of file attributes to associate with the document file when writing or updating it.
Returns a file extension to append to the file URL of the document file being written.
Saves document data to the specified location in the application sandbox.
Returns the file type to use for saving a document.
Ensures that document data is written safely to a specified location in the application sandbox.
Writes the document data to disk at the sandbox location indicated by a file URL.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
An object representing the location of a resource that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type-erased hashable value.

If you override this method and cannot write the document data for any reason, return by indirection an
object that encapsulates the reasons why you can’t. Otherwise, ignore this parameter.
